Yep, and by not wanting to sell this stuff, and at least gettting enough t=
o pay for parts & materials it kinda deprives ohters form using it----BUT--=
--I'm just one person, this other outfit seems to have someone to put the t=
hings together. 
 
 Frank


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: erick_hunter9@=
yahoo.comDate: Thu, 15 Nov 2007 16:29:14 -0800Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bru=
ce...





Thank you, Frank!  There you have it!  The last time I checked, =
the U.S. of A. was a "Capitalist" country...! That simply means making or b=
uying wholesale a product that will retail for more money than was invested=
 thus making a Profit.  You want an example?  You just have to look at Thom=
as Edison and Nickola Tesla.  Both were brilliant men,  pioneers in their f=
ield,  which was basically the same for both.  One was more brilliant than =
the other,  in turn the less brilliant "stole" ideas and products from the =
other.  The most brilliant was not a "Capitalist",  he devoted his time and=
 efforts to "bettering the lives of mankind".  The lessor was indeed a "Cap=
italist",  his motives were less noble,  however,  and he was willing to "b=
etter" mankind,  too,  but make a good profit in the process.  We all know =
the story...one is foremost in the eyes of the general public,  became pers=
onally rich and famous,  while the other died broke and without fanfare.  A=
 shame,  but factual,  none-the-less.  Would you work for free?  Would you =
supply people with something they want without recompense?  I think not.  I=
 certainly wouldn't!  Get real.  Bruce is going to post a capture, he says,=
 from Nickola Tesla.  I predict that it will be a warning... "Don't Do What=
 I Did!  Make a Profit!"    --Rod  
 
 
 
 
 
Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@=
hotmail.com> wrote:


 Well...Mean Bitch week was last week, so I was tryin=
g to be nice. Yeah, I can make a box for like $50 if it's on perf board, an=
d $100 if it on PCB, the bare board alone is about $46. The only problem I =
have is the time. It takes two weeks minumum to get a box together and work=
ing. Most people would like to get paid for their time. I make about $40 an=
 hour at my real job. ( been here 24 years!) Someday this stuff will get ma=
ss produced in China, and be included in every cell phone!  Frank-S


To: E=
VP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: warrior18eii@...: Thu, 15 Nov 2007 08=
:54:53 -0800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce...




I realize the time it ta=
kes to put things together. Especially units built from the ground up but i=
f you are taking on the duty of spreading the technology to help mankind, t=
o me it would be a labor of love. I can see and accept recovering productio=
n costs even, but this guy is looking to make a huge profit. You gained you=
r respect and credibility on the fact that you have a system that works and=
 you are willing to give it away when you didn't have to Frank. This guy is=
 coming out of the gate with a cheap imitation of EVP maker and your system=
 (both of which are free) and putting a huge price tag on it. It just don't=
 sit right with me!Honestly, I know it is none of my business what Ron does=
 but I guess I just needed to register my protest with this seemingly blata=
nt attempt at exploiting good though naive people.Regards,Frank R.
----- Or=
iginal Message ----From: Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...>To: evp-i=
tc@yahoogroups.comSent: Thursday, November 15, 2007 10:17:20 AMSubject: RE:=
 [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce...

 Interesting. I can see the price for early models.=
 This stuff take tons of time to put together. I don't want to fault anyone=
 ---yet. I couldn't figure out how to sell the things, and keep it honest, =
but all that does is deny everyone from using it.  Frank-S
To: EVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups .comFrom: warrior18eii@ yahoo.comDate: Wed, 14 Nov 2007 19:43:51 -0=
800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce...




$400 to $650 dollars a unit. This=
 guy is retarded! If he is selling this unit, he doesn't get it Frank!Frank=
 R.
